info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 13 at 1:45PM MST until September 13 at 3:15PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, central Cochise.
* WHEN...Until 315 PM MST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Some low-water crossings may become impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 145 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Willow Wash, Pinery Creek, Fivemile Creek, Big Sand Wash, Haberstock Wash and Turkey Creek. Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pearce-Sunsites, Sunizona and Kansas Settlement. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
